operation.Operation.corr¶

classmethod Operation.corr(xmatrix: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], ymatrix: ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]], window_size: int, minobs: int = 2) → ndarray[Any, dtype[Any]]¶

Calculate the rolling correlation

Note

This function uses the Pearson correlation coefficient. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pearson_correlation_coefficient)

Parameters:

  • xmatrix (array_like) -- The input matrix x.

  • ymatrix (array_like) -- The input matrix y.

  • window_size (int) -- The size of the rolling window.

  • minobs (int, optional) -- The minimum number of observations required for each window. By default 2.

Returns:

The resulting numpy array with the rolling correlation values applied

Return type:

ndarray

See also

pandas.core.window.rolling.Rolling.corr

Pandas equivalent method.

Alpha
